page.title: 05ECOLOGY CONTINUED
page.content: BECAUSE THE NEEDLES OF CONIFEROUS TREES DO NOT BREAK DOWN CAUSING THE SOILS TO BE ACIDIC. THE ONLY PLANTS WE FOUND GROWING IN THESE SOILS WERE FERNS AND A FEW BRAMBLES. THERE WERE PINE NEEDLES AND CONES COVERING THE FLOOR AND AMONG THIS LITTER WERE INSECT LARVAE. WE ALSO SAW SOME GREY SQUIRRELS AND RABBITS. THE AIMS OF OUR HEDGEROW SURVEY WERE TO FIND OUT WHETHER HEDGEROWS STILL EXISTEDEITHER SIDE OF THE ROADS AND TO SURVEY THE PLANT AND ANIMAL LIFE IN SAMPLE SECTIONS OF HEDGEROW. THE ONLY MAIN ROADS IN OUR AREA WERE THE A41(T) AND THE NEWPORT BY-PASS WHICH IS NOT MARKED ON THE MAP AS IT WAS COMPLETED IN OCTOBER 1984. HEDGEROWS ALONG THESE TWO MAJOR ROADS ARE NOT COMMON. ON THE BY-PASS WE SAW WIRE AND RANCH FENCING. ON THE A41(T) THERE ARE MAINLY SANDSTONE
